subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Wednesday, May 16, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Romney's three-legged 'stool'

COLUMBIA, South Carolina (CNN) -- The "stool" is a staple
of Mitt Romney's campaign pitch. To be successful, he argues,
Republicans need a strong message on the military, the economy,
and families.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/romneys-three-legged-stool.html

***

Richardson to make '08 bid official

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson will
announce his presidential candidacy Monday, a final formality
for a campaign that has been underway for several months, a
Democratic source tells CNN.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/richardson-to-make-08-bid-official.html

***

Too early to vote somebody off the island?

COLUMBIA, South Carolina (CNN) -- New Hampshire State
Republican Chairman Fergus Cullen said this was the
overwhelming consensus of GOP activists from around the country
the morning after the 2nd debate:

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/too-early-to-vote-somebody-off-island.html

***

Officials: Negotiations under way for
Wolfowitz to resign

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Embattled World Bank President Paul Wolfowitz and the White
House were in talks Wednesday afternoon with World Bank
officials to work out details of his resignation, senior
administration officials told CNN.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/officials-negotiations-under-way-for.html

***

Leahy and Specter to Justice: 'You ignored the
subpoena'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Justice
Department Wednesday told an angry Senate Judiciary Committee
Chairman the Department does not have the documents demanded in
his subpoena for all materials relating to Karl Rove's possible
involvement in the U.S. Attorney firings, and that Rove's
lawyer must have them.

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/leahy-and-specter-to-justice-you.html

***

Funding cutoff proposal fails

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The Senate decisively voted against a
measure that proposed cutting off funding for the Iraq war in
March of 2008, one of three Iraq measures the Senate voted on
Wednesday morning.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/funding-cutoff-proposal-fails.html

***

Hagel calls on Gonzales to resign

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Chuck Hagel, R-Nebraska, called on
Attorney General Alberto Gonzales to resign Tuesday, a day
after former Deputy Attorney General James Comey testified
before the Senate Judiciary Committee that Gonzales, then White
House counsel, tried to coerce a hospitalized Attorney General
John Ashcroft in 2004 to reauthorize the National Security
Agency's domestic surveillance program.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/hagel-calls-on-gonzales-to-resign.html

***

Blair visits U.S. for final summit

LONDON, England (AP) -- Tony Blair is to visit U.S.
President George W. Bush in what will likely be the British
prime minister's final visit to the White House as the
country's leader.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/blair-visits-us-for-final-summit.html

***

Clinton vows no more singing 

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- For her husband's 1992 campaign it was
Fleetwood Mac's "Don't Stop (Thinking About Tomorrow)."

For Sen. Hillary Clinton it's ...up to Web surfers to
decide.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-vows-no-more-singing.html

***

What else could Giuliani have been?

ATLANTA (CNN) -- Could former New York City Mayor Rudy
Giuliani really be an old softie?

He joked during
Thursday night's Republican presidential debate that being
called "soft" could help his reputation a little. And at a town
hall meeting in Charleston, South Carolina, Giuliani, hands on
knees, leaned down to ask children what they wanted to be when
they grow up.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/what-else-could-giuliani-have-been.html

***

Obama reports making over $500K from books

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Sen. Barack Obama saw a surge of
interest in his writings as he drew closer to a presidential
bid, earning more than half a million dollars in 2006 in
royalties for one book and an advance for another, according to
his financial disclosure report.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-reports-making-over-500k-from.html
